associated_user_id.description: The unique id of the associated user. Will be null unless type is ObserverEnrollment.

computed_current_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of computed_current_score, if available. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

computed_current_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course, ignoring ungraded assignments. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

computed_final_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of computed_final_score, if available. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

computed_final_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

course_id.description: The unique id of the course.

course_integration_id.description: The Course Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

course_section_id.description: The unique id of the user's section.

created_at.description: The created time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

current_grading_period_id.description: optional: The id of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_grading_period_title.description: optional: The name of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_computed_current_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_computed_current_score, if available. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_computed_current_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, ignoring ungraded assignments. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_computed_final_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_computed_final_score, if available. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_computed_final_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the current grading period.

current_period_override_score.description: The user's override score for the current grading period.

current_period_unposted_current_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_current_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_current_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_final_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments and including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

end_at.description: The end time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

enrollment_state.description: The state of the user's enrollment in the course.

has_grading_periods.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has grading periods set up. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

html_url.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page for this course enrollment.

id.description: The ID of the enrollment.

last_activity_at.description: The last activity time of the user for the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

last_attended_at.description: The last attended date of the user for the enrollment in a course, in ISO8601 format.

limit_privileges_to_course_section.description: User can only access his or her own course section.

override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the course.

override_score.description: The user's override score for the course.

role.description: The enrollment role, for course-level permissions. This field will match `type` if the enrollment role has not been customized.

role_id.description: The id of the enrollment role.

root_account_id.description: The unique id of the user's account.

section_integration_id.description: The Section Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_account_id.description: The SIS Account ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_course_id.description: The SIS Course ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

sis_section_id.description: The SIS Section ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS User ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

start_at.description: The start time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

total_activity_time.description: The total activity time of the user for the enrollment, in seconds.

totals_for_all_grading_periods_option.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has the Display Totals for 'All Grading Periods' feature enabled. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

unposted_current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins.

unposted_current_score.description: The user's current score in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_score.description: The user's final score for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

updated_at.description: The updated time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

user_id.description: The unique id of the user.

end_at.description: The datetime of the end of the term.

id.description: The unique identifier for the enrollment term.

overrides.description: Term date overrides for specific enrollment types

sis_import_id.description: the unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

sis_term_id.description: The SIS id of the term. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

start_at.description: The datetime of the start of the term.

workflow_state.description: The state of the term. Can be 'active' or 'deleted'.

created_at.description: the date and time this export was requested

id.description: the unique identifier for the export

progress_url.description: The api endpoint for polling the current progress

user_id.description: The ID of the user who started the export

workflow_state.description: Current state of the ePub export: created exporting exported generating generated failed

created_at.description: the date and time this export was requested

id.description: the unique identifier for the export

progress_url.description: The api endpoint for polling the current progress

user_id.description: The ID of the user who started the export

workflow_state.description: Current state of the ePub export: created exporting exported generating generated failed

created_at.description: When this external feed was added to Canvas

display_name.description: The title of the feed, pulled from the feed itself. If the feed hasn't yet been pulled, a temporary name will be synthesized based on the URL

header_match.description: If not null, only feed entries whose title contains this string will trigger new posts in Canvas

id.description: The ID of the feed

url.description: The HTTP/HTTPS URL to the feed

verbosity.description: The verbosity setting determines how much of the feed's content is imported into Canvas as part of the posting. 'link_only' means that only the title and a link to the item. 'truncate' means that a summary of the first portion of the item body will be used. 'full' means that the full item body will be used.

new_tab.description: Whether or not there is a new tab for the external tool

url.description: URL to the external tool

context_id.description: The ID of the object the Favorite refers to

context_type.description: The type of the object the Favorite refers to (currently, only 'Course' is supported)

applies_to.description:
The type of object the feature applies to (RootAccount, Account, Course, or User):
 * RootAccount features may only be controlled by flags on root accounts.
 * Account features may be controlled by flags on accounts and their parent accounts.
 * Course features may be controlled by flags on courses and their parent accounts.
 * User features may be controlled by flags on users and site admin only.

autoexpand.description: Whether the details of the feature are autoexpanded on page load vs. the user clicking to expand.

beta.description: Whether the feature is a beta feature. If true, the feature may not be fully polished and may be subject to change in the future.

development.description: Whether the feature is in active development. Features in this state are only visible in test and beta instances and are not yet available for production use.

display_name.description: The user-visible name of the feature

enable_at.description: The date this feature will be globally enabled, or null if this is not planned. (This information is subject to change.)

name.description: The symbolic name of the feature, used in FeatureFlags

release_notes_url.description: A URL to the release notes describing the feature

root_opt_in.description: If true, a feature that is 'allowed' globally will be 'off' by default in root accounts. Otherwise, root accounts inherit the global 'allowed' setting, which allows sub-accounts and courses to turn features on with no root account action.

context_id.description: The id of the object to which this flag applies (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

context_type.description: The type of object to which this flag applies (Account, Course, or User). (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

locked.description: If set, this feature flag cannot be changed in the caller's context because the flag is set 'off' or 'on' in a higher context

state.description: The policy for the feature at this context.  can be 'off', 'allowed', or 'on'.

context_id.description: The id of the object to which this flag applies (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

context_type.description: The type of object to which this flag applies (Account, Course, or User). (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

locked.description: If set, this feature flag cannot be changed in the caller's context because the flag is set 'off' or 'on' in a higher context

state.description: The policy for the feature at this context.  can be 'off', 'allowed', or 'on'.

FederatedAttributesConfig.description: A mapping of Canvas attribute names to attribute names that a provider may send, in order to update the value of these attributes when a user logs in. The values can be a FederatedAttributeConfig, or a raw string corresponding to the "attribute" property of a FederatedAttributeConfig. In responses, full FederatedAttributeConfig objects are returned if JIT provisioning is enabled, otherwise just the attribute names are returned.

admin_roles.description: A comma separated list of role names to grant to the user. Note that these only apply at the root account level, and not sub-accounts. If the attribute is not marked for provisioning only, the user will also be removed from any other roles they currently hold that are not still specified by the IdP.

display_name.description: The full display name of the user

given_name.description: The first, or given, name of the user

integration_id.description: The secondary unique identifier for SIS purposes

name.description: The full name of the user

sortable_name.description: The full name of the user for sorting purposes

surname.description: The surname, or last name, of the user

for_submissions.description: If true, indicates this is a read-only folder containing files submitted to assignments

current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade.

current_score.description: The user's current score in the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this score.

final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade.

final_score.description: The user's final score for the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this score.

html_url.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page for the user's grades, if this is a student enrollment.

unposted_current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins.

unposted_current_score.description: The user's current score in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_score.description: The user's final score for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

excused_after.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused after the change.

excused_before.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused before the change.

graded_anonymously.description: Boolean indicating whether the student name was visible when the grade was given. Could be null if the grade change record was created before this feature existed.

id.description: ID of the event.

request_id.description: The unique request id of the request during the grade change.

version_number.description: Version Number of the grade change submission.

assignment.description: ID of the assignment associated with the event

course.description: ID of the course associated with the event. will match the context_id in the associated assignment if the context type for the assignment is a course

grader.description: ID of the grader associated with the event. will match the grader_id in the associated submission.

page_view.description: ID of the page view during the event if it exists.

student.description: ID of the student associated with the event. will match the user_id in the associated submission.

assignments.description: the assignment groups for all submissions in this response that were graded by this user.  The details are not nested inside here, but the fact that an assignment is present here means that the grader did grade submissions for this assignment on the contextual date. You can use the id of a grader and of an assignment to make another API call to find all submissions for a grader/assignment combination on a given date.

id.description: the user_id of the user who graded the contained submissions

name.description: the name of the user who graded the contained submissions

close_date.description: Grades can only be changed before the close date of the grading period.

end_date.description: The end date of the grading period.

id.description: The unique identifier for the grading period.

is_closed.description: If true, the grading period's close_date has passed.

start_date.description: The start date of the grading period.

title.description: The title for the grading period.

weight.description: A weight value that contributes to the overall weight of a grading period set which is used to calculate how much assignments in this period contribute to the total grade.

drop_highest.description: Number of highest scores to be dropped for each user.

drop_lowest.description: Number of lowest scores to be dropped for each user.

never_drop.description: Assignment IDs that should never be dropped.

name.description: The name for an entry value within a GradingStandard that describes the range of the value

value.description: The value for the name of the entry within a GradingStandard.  The entry represents the lower bound of the range for the entry. This range includes the value up to the next entry in the GradingStandard, or 100 if there is no upper bound. The lowest value will have a lower bound range of 0.

context_id.description: the id for the context either the Account or Course id

context_type.description: the context this standard is associated with, either 'Account' or 'Course'

grading_scheme.description: A list of GradingSchemeEntry that make up the Grading Standard as an array of values with the scheme name and value

id.description: the id of the grading standard

title.description: the title of the grading standard

avatar_url.description: The url of the group's avatar

context_type.description: The course or account that the group belongs to. The pattern here is that whatever the context_type is, there will be an _id field named after that type. So if instead context_type was 'account', the course_id field would be replaced by an account_id field.

description.description: A description of the group. This is plain text.

followed_by_user.description: Whether or not the current user is following this group.

group_category_id.description: The ID of the group's category.

id.description: The ID of the group.

is_public.description: Whether or not the group is public.  Currently only community groups can be made public.  Also, once a group has been set to public, it cannot be changed back to private.

join_level.description: How people are allowed to join the group.  For all groups except for community groups, the user must share the group's parent course or account.  For student organized or community groups, where a user can be a member of as many or few as they want, the applicable levels are 'parent_context_auto_join', 'parent_context_request', and 'invitation_only'.  For class groups, where students are divided up and should only be part of one group of the category, this value will always be 'invitation_only', and is not relevant. * If 'parent_context_auto_join', anyone can join and will be automatically accepted. * If 'parent_context_request', anyone  can request to join, which must be approved by a group moderator. * If 'invitation_only', only those how have received an invitation my join the group, by accepting that invitation.

members_count.description: The number of members currently in the group

name.description: The display name of the group.

permissions.description: optional: the permissions the user has for the group. returned only for a single group and include[]=permissions

role.description: Certain types of groups have special role designations. Currently, these include: 'communities', 'student_organized', and 'imported'. Regular course/account groups have a role of null.

sis_group_id.description: The SIS ID of the group. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import if created through SIS. Only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

storage_quota_mb.description: the storage quota for the group, in megabytes

auto_leader.description: Gives instructors the ability to automatically have group leaders assigned.  Values include 'random', 'first', and null; 'random' picks a student from the group at random as the leader, 'first' sets the first student to be assigned to the group as the leader

context_type.description: The course or account that the category group belongs to. The pattern here is that whatever the context_type is, there will be an _id field named after that type. So if instead context_type was 'Course', the course_id field would be replaced by an course_id field.

group_limit.description: If self-signup is enabled, group_limit can be set to cap the number of users in each group. If null, there is no limit.

id.description: The ID of the group category.

name.description: The display name of the group category.

role.description: Certain types of group categories have special role designations. Currently, these include: 'communities', 'student_organized', and 'imported'. Regular course/account group categories have a role of null.

self_signup.description: If the group category allows users to join a group themselves, thought they may only be a member of one group per group category at a time. Values include 'restricted', 'enabled', and null 'enabled' allows students to assign themselves to a group 'restricted' restricts them to only joining a group in their section null disallows students from joining groups

sis_group_category_id.description: The SIS identifier for the group category. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage or view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

group_id.description: The id of the group object to which the membership belongs

id.description: The id of the membership object

just_created.description: optional: whether or not the record was just created on a create call (POST), i.e. was the user just added to the group, or was the user already a member

moderator.description: Whether or not the user is a moderator of the group (the must also be an active member of the group to moderate)

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import if created through SIS. Only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

user_id.description: The id of the user object to which the membership belongs

workflow_state.description: The current state of the membership. Current possible values are 'accepted', 'invited', and 'requested'

available_to.description: The roles that have access to this help link

id.description: The ID of the help link

subtext.description: The description of the help link
subtext.example: Questions are submitted to your instructor

text.description: The name of the help link

type.description: The type of the help link

url.description: The URL of the help link

custom_help_links.description: Help links defined by the account. Could include default help links.

default_help_links.description: Default help links provided when account has not set help links of their own.

example.subtext: Questions are submitted to your instructor
If Canvas misbehaves, tell us about it

token.description: The signed, encrypted, base64 encoded JWT

id.description: a short string identifying the license

url.description: a link to the license text

asset_string.description: Asset string for the object causing the lock

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked. Must be after the due date.

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked. Must be before the due date.

due_at.description: The due date for the assignment. If a user id is supplied and an assignment override is in place this field will reflect the due date as it applies to the user.

content_migration_url.description: API url to the content migration

created_at.description: timestamp

description.description: Description of the issue for the end-user
description.example: Questions in this quiz couldn't be converted

error_message.description: Site administrator error message (If the requesting user has permissions)

error_report_html_url.description: Link to a Canvas error report if present (If the requesting user has permissions)

fix_issue_html_url.description: HTML Url to the Canvas page to investigate the issue

id.description: the unique identifier for the issue

issue_type.description: Severity of the issue: todo, warning, error

workflow_state.description: Current state of the issue: active, resolved

name.description: Description of the package type expected

required_settings.description: A list of fields this system requires

requires_file_upload.description: Whether this endpoint requires a file upload

type.description: The value to pass to the create endpoint

completed_at.description: the date the calling user completed the module (Optional; present only if the caller is a student or if the optional parameter 'student_id' is included)

id.description: the unique identifier for the module

items.description: The contents of this module, as an array of Module Items. (Present only if requested via include[]=items AND the module is not deemed too large by Canvas.)

items_count.description: The number of items in the module

items_url.description: The API URL to retrive this module's items

position.description: the position of this module in the course (1-based)

prerequisite_module_ids.description: IDs of Modules that must be completed before this one is unlocked

publish_final_grade.description: if the student's final grade for the course should be published to the SIS upon completion of this module

published.description: (Optional) Whether this module is published. This field is present only if the caller has permission to view unpublished modules.

require_sequential_progress.description: Whether module items must be unlocked in order

state.description: The state of this Module for the calling user one of 'locked', 'unlocked', 'started', 'completed' (Optional; present only if the caller is a student or if the optional parameter 'student_id' is included)

unlock_at.description: (Optional) the date this module will unlock

workflow_state.description: the state of the module: 'active', 'deleted'

content_id.description: the id of the object referred to applies to 'File', 'Discussion', 'Assignment', 'Quiz', 'ExternalTool' types

external_url.description: (only for 'ExternalUrl' and 'ExternalTool' types) external url that the item points to

indent.description: 0-based indent level; module items may be indented to show a hierarchy

module_id.description: the id of the Module this item appears in

new_tab.description: (only for 'ExternalTool' type) whether the external tool opens in a new tab

page_url.description: (only for 'Page' type) unique locator for the linked wiki page

position.description: the position of this item in the module (1-based)

published.description: (Optional) Whether this module item is published. This field is present only if the caller has permission to view unpublished items.

created_at.description: The date the outcome import was created.

ended_at.description: The date the outcome import finished. Returns null if not finished.

id.description: The unique identifier for the outcome import.

processing_errors.description: An array of row number / error message pairs. Returns the first 25 errors.

progress.description: The progress of the outcome import.

updated_at.description: The date the outcome import was last updated.

workflow_state.description:
The current state of the outcome import.
 - 'created': The outcome import has been created.
 - 'importing': The outcome import is currently processing.
 - 'succeeded': The outcome import has completed successfully.
 - 'failed': The outcome import failed.

assessed.description: whether this outcome has been used to assess a student in the context of this outcome link.  In other words, this will be set to true if the context is a course, and a student has been assessed with this outcome in that course.

can_unlink.description: whether this outcome link is manageable and is not the last link to an aligned outcome

context_id.description: the context owning the outcome link. will match the context owning the outcome group containing the outcome link; included for convenience. may be null for links in global outcome groups.

url.description: the URL for fetching/updating the outcome link. should be treated as opaque

OutcomeResult.description: A student's result for an outcome

id.description: A unique identifier for this result

mastery.description: True if the outcome been mastered

possible.description: total possible points for the score

submitted_or_assessed_at.description: The datetime the resulting OutcomeResult was submitted at, or absent that, when it was assessed.

links.description: Unique identifiers of objects associated with this result

percent.description: score's percent of maximum points possible for outcome, scaled to reflect any custom mastery levels that differ from the learning outcome

OutcomeResultResponse.description: Assessment Outcome Results and optional info (enabled via the "include" parameter on the request)

outcome_results.description: Specific outcome results for each assessment

alignments.description: Alignments related to the outcome results (optionally included)

outcomes.description: Outcomes related to the outcome results (optionally included)

outcome_groups.description: Outcome Groups related to the outcome results (optionally included)

outcome_links.description: Outcome Links related to the outcome results (optionally included)

outcome_paths.description: Outcome Paths related to the outcome results (optionally included)

users.description: Users related to the outcome results (optionally included)

outcome.description: The id of the related outcome

score.description: The rollup score for the outcome, based on the student alignment scores related to the outcome. This could be null if the student has no related scores.

count.description: The number of alignment scores included in this rollup.

course.description: If an aggregate result was requested, the course field will be present. Otherwise, the user and section field will be present (Optional) The id of the course that this rollup applies to

user.description: (Optional) The id of the user that this rollup applies to

section.description: (Optional) The id of the section the user is in

OutcomeRollupResponse.description: Assessment Outcome Rollup Results and optional info (enabled via the "include" parameter on the request)

courses.description: Courses related to the rollup (optionally included)

outcomes.description: Outcomes related to the rollup (optionally included)

outcome_groups.description: Outcome Groups related to the rollup (optionally included)

outcome_links.description: Outcome Links related to the rollup (optionally included)

outcome_paths.description: Outcome Paths related to the rollup (optionally included)

users.description: Users related to the rollup (optionally included)

OutcomePath.description: The full path to an outcome

id.description: A unique identifier for this outcome

name.description: The title of the outcome or outcome group

body.description: the page content, in HTML (present when requesting a single page; omitted when listing pages)

created_at.description: the creation date for the page

editing_roles.description: roles allowed to edit the page; comma-separated list comprising a combination of 'teachers', 'students', 'members', and/or 'public' if not supplied, course defaults are used

front_page.description: whether this page is the front page for the wiki

hide_from_students.description: (DEPRECATED) whether this page is hidden from students (note: this is always reflected as the inverse of the published value)

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This page is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

published.description: whether the page is published (true) or draft state (false).

updated_at.description: the date the page was last updated

url.description: the unique locator for the page

latest.description: whether this is the latest revision or not

revision_id.description: an identifier for this revision of the page

updated_at.description: the time when this revision was saved

url.description: the following fields are not included in the index action and may be omitted from the show action via summary=1 the historic url of the page

PageView.description: The record of a user page view access in Canvas

action.description: The rails action that handled the request

app_name.description: If the request is from an API request, the app that generated the access token

asset_type.description: The type of asset in the context for the request, if any

context_type.description: The type of context for the request

contributed.description: This field is deprecated, and will always be false

controller.description: The rails controller that handled the request

created_at.description: When the request was made

http_method.description: The HTTP method such as GET or POST

id.description: A UUID representing the page view.  This is also the unique request id

interaction_seconds.description: An approximation of how long the user spent on the page, in seconds

participated.description: True if the request counted as participating, such as submitting homework

remote_ip.description: The origin IP address of the request

render_time.description: How long the response took to render, in seconds

url.description: The URL requested

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the browser or program that made the request
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/536.30.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/6.0.5 Safari/536.30.1

user_request.description: A flag indicating whether the request was user-initiated, or automatic (such as an AJAX call)

PageViewLinks.description: The links of a page view access in Canvas

account.description: The ID of the account context for this page view

asset.description: The ID of the asset for the request, if any

context.description: The ID of the context for the request (course id if context_type is Course, etc)

real_user.description: The ID of the actual user who made this request, if the request was made by a user who was masquerading

user.description: The ID of the user for this page view

assessor.description: The User object for the assessor if the user include parameter is provided (see user API) (optional)

asset_id.description: The id for the asset associated with this Peer Review

id.description: The id of the Peer Review

submission_comments.description: The submission comments associated with this Peer Review if the submission_comment include parameter is provided (see submissions API) (optional)

user.description: the User object for the owner of the asset if the user include parameter is provided (see user API) (optional)

user_id.description: The user id for the owner of the asset

workflow_state.description: The state of the Peer Review, either 'assigned' or 'completed'

course_id.description: The course that the note is in relation too, if applicable

description.description: The description of the planner note
description.example: I need to bring books tomorrow for my course on biology

id.description: The ID of the planner note

linked_object_html_url.description: the Canvas web URL of the linked learning object

linked_object_id.description: the id of the linked learning object

linked_object_type.description: the type of the linked learning object

linked_object_url.description: the API URL of the linked learning object

title.description: The title for a planner note

todo_date.description: The datetime of when the planner note should show up on their planner

user_id.description: The id of the associated user creating the planner note

workflow_state.description: The current published state of the planner note

PlannerOverride.description: User-controlled setting for whether an item should be displayed on the planner or not

assignment_id.description: The id of the plannable's associated assignment, if it has one

created_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was created

deleted_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was deleted, if applicable

dismissed.description: Controls whether or not the associated plannable item shows up in the opportunities list

id.description: The ID of the planner override

marked_complete.description: Controls whether or not the associated plannable item is marked complete on the planner

plannable_id.description: The id of the associated object for the planner override

plannable_type.description: The type of the associated object for the planner override

updated_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was updated

user_id.description: The id of the associated user for the planner override

workflow_state.description: The current published state of the item, synced with the associated object

id.description: The unique identifier for the poll

description.description: The description of the poll

created_at.description: The time at which the poll was created

user_id.description: The unique identifier for the user that created the poll

total_results.description: An aggregate of the results of all associated poll sessions, with the poll choice id as the key, and the aggregated submission count as the value.

ratings.description: An array of proficiency ratings. See the ProficiencyRating specification above.

Profile.description: Profile details for a Canvas user.

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

effective_locale.description: This field is not in the Canvas API specification

id.description: The ID of the user.

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.

pronouns.description: The pronouns set on the profile (as of 12/02/2023 this is not in the API specification, but is returned with a profile call)

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

created_at.description: the time the job was created

id.description: the ID of the Progress object

results.description: optional results of the job. omitted when job is still pending

updated_at.description: the time the job was last updated

url.description: url where a progress update can be retrieved

user_id.description: the id of the user who started the job

workflow_state.description: the state of the job one of 'queued', 'running', 'completed', 'failed'

created_at.description: the time the job was created

id.description: the ID of the Progress object

results.description: optional results of the job. omitted when job is still pending

updated_at.description: the time the job was last updated

url.description: url where a progress update can be retrieved

user_id.description: the id of the user who started the job

workflow_state.description: the state of the job one of 'queued', 'running', 'completed', 'failed'

final.description: Whether this is the 'final' provisional grade created by the moderator

grade_matches_current_submission.description: Whether the grade was applied to the most current submission (false if the student resubmitted after grading)

provisional_grade_id.description: The identifier for the provisional grade

speedgrader_url.description: A link to view this provisional grade in SpeedGrader

access_code.description: access code to restrict quiz access

all_dates.description: list of due dates for the quiz

allowed_attempts.description: how many times a student can take the quiz -1 = unlimited attempts

anonymous_submissions.description: Whether survey submissions will be kept anonymous (only applicable to 'graded_survey', 'survey' quiz types)

assignment_group_id.description: the ID of the quiz's assignment group:

cant_go_back.description: lock questions after answering? only valid if one_question_at_a_time=true

description.description: the description of the quiz
description.example: This is a quiz on Act 3 of Hamlet

hide_correct_answers_at.description: prevent the students from seeing correct answers after the specified date has passed. only valid if show_correct_answers=true

hide_results.description: let students see their quiz responses? possible values: null, 'always', 'until_after_last_attempt'

html_url.description: the HTTP/HTTPS URL to the quiz

id.description: the ID of the quiz

ip_filter.description: IP address or range that quiz access is limited to

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This quiz is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

mobile_url.description: a url suitable for loading the quiz in a mobile webview.  it will persiste the headless session and, for quizzes in public courses, will force the user to login

one_question_at_a_time.description: show one question at a time?

one_time_results.description: prevent the students from seeing their results more than once (right after they submit the quiz)

points_possible.description: The total point value given to the quiz

preview_url.description: A url that can be visited in the browser with a POST request to preview a quiz as the teacher. Only present when the user may grade

published.description: whether the quiz has a published or unpublished draft state.

question_count.description: the number of questions in the quiz

question_types.description: List of question types in the quiz

quiz_extensions_url.description: Link to endpoint to send extensions for this quiz.

scoring_policy.description: which quiz score to keep (only if allowed_attempts != 1) possible values: 'keep_highest', 'keep_latest'

show_correct_answers.description: show which answers were correct when results are shown? only valid if hide_results=null

show_correct_answers_at.description: when should the correct answers be visible by students? only valid if show_correct_answers=true

show_correct_answers_last_attempt.description: restrict the show_correct_answers option above to apply only to the last submitted attempt of a quiz that allows multiple attempts. only valid if show_correct_answers=true and allowed_attempts > 1

speedgrader_url.description: Link to Speed Grader for this quiz. Will not be present if quiz is unpublished

unpublishable.description: Whether the assignment's 'published' state can be changed to false. Will be false if there are student submissions for the quiz.

version_number.description: Current version number of the quiz

QuizAssignmentOverride.description: Set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

base.description: If this property is present, it means that dates in this structure are not based on an assignment override, but are instead for all students.

due_at.description: The date after which any quiz submission is considered late.

id.description: ID of the assignment override, unless this is the base construct, in which case the 'id' field is omitted.

lock_at.description: When the quiz will stop being available for taking. A value of null means it can always be taken.

title.description: Title of the section this assignment override is for, if any.

unlock_at.description: Date when the quiz becomes available for taking.

QuizAssignmentOverrideSet.description: Set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

quiz_id.description: ID of the quiz those dates are for.

QuizAssignmentOverrideSetContainer.description: Container for set of assignment-overridden dates for a quiz.

assessment_question_bank_id.description: The ID of the Assessment question bank to pull questions from.

id.description: The ID of the question group.

name.description: The name of the question group.

pick_count.description: The number of questions to pick from the group to display to the student.

position.description: The order in which the question group will be retrieved and displayed.

question_points.description: The amount of points allotted to each question in the group.

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the question group belongs to.

QuizPermissions.description: Permissions the user has for the quiz

create.description: whether the user may create a new quiz

manage.description: whether the user may edit, update, or delete the quiz

read.description: whether the user can view the quiz

read_statistics.description: whether the user may view quiz statistics for this quiz

review_grades.description: whether the user may review grades for all quiz submissions for this quiz

submit.description: whether the user may submit a submission for the quiz

update.description: whether the user may update the quiz

answers.description: An array of available answers to display to the student.

correct_comments.description: The comments to display if the student answers the question correctly.

id.description: The ID of the quiz question.

incorrect_comments.description: The comments to display if the student answers incorrectly.
incorrect_comments.example: Unfortunately, that IS a prime number.

neutral_comments.description: The comments to display regardless of how the student answered.
neutral_comments.example: Goldbach's conjecture proposes that every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.

points_possible.description: The maximum amount of points possible received for getting this question correct.

position.description: The order in which the question will be retrieved and displayed.

question_text.example: Which of the following is NOT a prime number?

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the question belongs to.

anonymous.description: boolean indicating whether the report is for an anonymous survey. if true, no student names will be included in the csv

created_at.description: when the report was created

generatable.description: boolean indicating whether the report can be generated, which is true unless the quiz is a survey one

id.description: the ID of the quiz report

includes_all_versions.description: boolean indicating whether the report represents all submissions or only the most recent ones for each student

progress_url.description: if the report has not yet finished generating, a URL where information about its progress can be retrieved. refer to the Progress API for more information (Note: not available in JSON-API format)

readable_type.description: a human-readable (and localized) version of the report_type

report_type.description: which type of report this is possible values: 'student_analysis', 'item_analysis'

updated_at.description: when the report was last updated

url.description: the API endpoint for this report

attempt.description: For quizzes that allow multiple attempts, this field specifies the quiz submission attempt number.

end_at.description: The time at which the quiz submission will be overdue, and be flagged as a late submission.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student was allowed to re-take the quiz over the multiple-attempt limit.

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time allowed for the quiz submission, in minutes.

finished_at.description: The time at which the student submitted the quiz submission.

fudge_points.description: Number of points the quiz submission's score was fudged by.

has_seen_results.description: Whether the student has viewed their results to the quiz.

id.description: The ID of the quiz submission.

kept_score.description: For quizzes that allow multiple attempts, this is the score that will be used, which might be the score of the latest, or the highest, quiz submission.

manually_unlocked.description: The student can take the quiz even if it's locked for everyone else

overdue_and_needs_submission.description: Indicates whether the quiz submission is overdue and needs submission

quiz_id.description: The ID of the Quiz the quiz submission belongs to.

score.description: The score of the quiz submission, if graded.

score_before_regrade.description: The original score of the quiz submission prior to any re-grading.

started_at.description: The time at which the student started the quiz submission.

submission_id.description: The ID of the Submission the quiz submission represents.

time_spent.description: Amount of time spent, in seconds.

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that made the quiz submission.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the quiz submission. Possible values: ['untaken'|'pending_review'|'complete'|'settings_only'|'preview'].

answer.description: The provided answer (if any) for this question. The format of this parameter depends on the type of the question, see the Appendix for more information.

answers.description: The possible answers for this question when those possible answers are necessary.  The presence of this parameter is dependent on permissions.

id.description: The ID of the QuizQuestion this answer is for.

created_at.description: The date and time the report was created.

current_line.description: This is the current line count being written to the report. It updates every 1000 records.

ended_at.description: The date and time the report finished processing.

file_url.description: The url to the report download.

id.description: The unique identifier for the report.

started_at.description: The date and time the report started processing.

ReportParameters.description: The parameters returned will vary for each report.

accounts.description: If true, account data will be included. If false, account data will be omitted.

course_id.description: The id of the course to report on

courses.description: If true, course data will be included. If false, course data will be omitted.

end_at.description: The end date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

enrollment_state.description: Include enrollment state. Defaults to 'all' Options: ['active'| 'invited'| 'creation_pending'| 'deleted'| 'rejected'| 'completed'| 'inactive'| 'all']

enrollment_term_id.description: The canvas id of the term to get grades from

enrollments.description: If true, enrollment data will be included. If false, enrollment data will be omitted.

groups.description: If true, group data will be included. If false, group data will be omitted.

include_deleted.description: If true, deleted objects will be included. If false, deleted objects will be omitted.

include_enrollment_state.description: If true, enrollment state will be included. If false, enrollment state will be omitted. Defaults to false.

order.description: The sort order for the csv, Options: 'users', 'courses', 'outcomes'.

sections.description: If true, section data will be included. If false, section data will be omitted.

start_at.description: The beginning date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

terms.description: If true, term data will be included. If false, term data will be omitted.

users.description: If true, user data will be included. If false, user data will be omitted.

xlist.description: If true, data for crosslisted courses will be included. If false, data for crosslisted courses will be omitted.

account.description: JSON representation of the account the role is in.

base_role_type.description: The role type that is being used as a base for this role. For account-level roles, this is 'AccountMembership'. For course-level roles, it is an enrollment type.

permissions.description: A dictionary of permissions keyed by name (see permissions input parameter in the 'Create a role' API).

role.description: The label of the role. (Deprecated alias for 'label')

workflow_state.description: The state of the role: 'active', 'inactive', or 'built_in'

assessments.description: If an assessment type is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of rubric assessment objects for a given rubric, based on the assessment type requested. If the user does not request an assessment type this key will be absent.

free_form_criterion_comments.description: whether or not free-form comments are used

id.description: the ID of the rubric

artifact_attempt.description: the current number of attempts made on the object of the assessment

artifact_id.description: the id of the object of the assessment

assessment_type.description: the type of assessment. values will be either 'grading', 'peer_review', or 'provisional_grade'

assessor_id.description: user id of the person who made the assessment

comments.description: (Optional) If 'comments_only' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will include only the comments portion of their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

data.description: (Optional) If 'full' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will have their full details contained in their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

id.description: the ID of the rubric

rubric_id.description: the rubric the assessment belongs to

id.description: The id of rubric criteria.

learning_outcome_id.description: (Optional) The id of the learning outcome this criteria uses, if any.

vendor_guid.description: (Optional) The 3rd party vendor's GUID for the outcome this criteria references, if any.

SSOSettings.description: Settings that are applicable across an account's authentication configuration, even if there are multiple individual providers

auth_discovery_url.description: If a discovery url is set, canvas will forward all users to that URL when they need to be authenticated. That page will need to then help the user figure out where they need to go to log in. If no discovery url is configured, the first configuration will be used to attempt to authenticate the user.

change_password_url.description: The url to redirect users to for password resets. Leave blank for default Canvas behavior

login_handle_name.description: The label used for unique login identifiers.

unknown_user_url.description: If an unknown user url is set, Canvas will forward to that url when a service authenticates a user, but that user does not exist in Canvas. The default behavior is to present an error.

action.description: The controller action the scope is associated to

controller.description: The controller the scope is associated to

resource.description: The resource the scope is associated with

verb.description: The HTTP verb for the scope

course_id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the course in which the section belongs

end_at.description: the end date for the section, if applicable

id.description: The unique identifier for the section.

integration_id.description: Optional: The integration ID of the section. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

nonxlist_course_id.description: The unique identifier of the original course of a cross-listed section

restrict_enrollments_to_section_dates.description: Restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the section

sis_course_id.description: The unique SIS identifier for the course in which the section belongs. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import if created through SIS. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

sis_section_id.description: The sis id of the section. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

start_at.description: the start date for the section, if applicable

students.description: optional array of students for the section, if include=['students'] is set and applicable

total_students.description: optional: the total number of active and invited students in the section

account_id.description: The id of the account it should be shared within.

brand_config_md5.description: The md5 (since BrandConfigs are identified by MD5 and not numeric id) of the BrandConfig to share.

created_at.description: When this was created

id.description: The shared_brand_config identifier.

name.description: The name to share this theme as

add_sis_stickiness.description: Whether stickiness was added to the batch changes.

batch_mode.description: Whether the import was run in batch mode.

batch_mode_term_id.description: The term the batch was limited to.

created_at.description: The date the SIS import was created.

csv_attachments.description: An array of CSV files for processing

diffed_against_import_id.description: The ID of the SIS Import that this import was diffed against

diffing_data_set_identifier.description: The identifier of the data set that this SIS batch diffs against

ended_at.description: The date the SIS import finished. Returns null if not finished.

id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import.

multi_term_batch_mode.description: Enables batch mode against all terms in term file. Requires change_threshold to be set.

example: Error while importing CSV. Please contact support.

processing_warnings.description: Only imports that are complete will get this data. An array of CSV_file/warning_message pairs.
example: user John Doe has already claimed john_doe's requested login information, skipping

progress.description: The progress of the SIS import. The progress will reset when using batch_mode and have a different progress for the cleanup stage

skip_deletes.description: When set the import will skip any deletes.

updated_at.description: The date the SIS import was last updated.

workflow_state.description:
The current state of the SIS import.
 - 'created': The SIS import has been created.
 - 'importing': The SIS import is currently processing.
 - 'cleanup_batch': The SIS import is currently cleaning up courses, sections, and enrollments not included in the batch for batch_mode imports.
 - 'imported': The SIS import has completed successfully.
 - 'imported_with_messages': The SIS import completed with errors or warnings.
 - 'aborted': The SIS import was aborted.
 - 'failed_with_messages': The SIS import failed with errors.
 - 'failed': The SIS import failed.

batch_courses_deleted.description: the number of courses that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if courses were deleted

batch_enrollments_deleted.description: the number of enrollments that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if enrollments were deleted

batch_sections_deleted.description: the number of sections that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if sections were deleted

supplied_batches.description: Which files were included in the SIS import

file.description: The file where the error message occurred.

message.description: The error message that from the record.
message.example: No short_name given for course C001

row.description: The line number where the error occurred. Some Importers do not yet support this. This is a 1 based index starting with the header row.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import.

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this submission without reference to the owning user. Only included if the caller has administrator access for the current account.

assignment_visible.description: Whether the assignment is visible to the user who submitted the assignment. Submissions where `assignment_visible` is false no longer count towards the student's grade and the assignment can no longer be accessed by the student. `assignment_visible` becomes false for submissions that do not have a grade and whose assignment is no longer assigned to the student's section.

attempt.description: This is the submission attempt number.

body.description: The content of the submission, if it was submitted directly in a text field.

course.description: The submission's course (see the course API) (optional)

excused.description: Whether the assignment is excused.  Excused assignments have no impact on a user's grade.

extra_attempts.description: Extra submission attempts allowed fro the given user and assignment.

grade.description: The grade for the submission, translated into the assignment grading scheme (so a letter grade, for example).

grade_matches_current_submission.description: A boolean flag which is false if the student has re-submitted since the submission was last graded.

grader_id.description: The id of the user who graded the submission. This will be null for submissions that haven't been graded yet. It will be a positive number if a real user has graded the submission and a negative number if the submission was graded by a process (e.g. Quiz autograder and autograding LTI tools).  Specifically autograded quizzes set grader_id to the negative of the quiz id.  Submissions autograded by LTI tools set grader_id to the negative of the tool id.

html_url.description: URL to the submission. This will require the user to log in.

late.description: Whether the submission was made after the applicable due date

late_policy_status.description: The status of the submission in relation to the late policy. Can be late, missing, none, or null.

points_deducted.description: The amount of points automatically deducted from the score by the missing/late policy for a late or missing assignment.

posted_at.description: The date this submission was posted to the student, or nil if it has not been posted

preview_url.description: URL to the submission preview. This will require the user to log in.

read_status.description: The read status of this submission for the given user (optional). Including read_status will mark submission(s) as read.

redo_request.description: This indicates whether the submission has been reassigned by the instructor.

seconds_late.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that an submission is late by.

submitted_at.description: The timestamp when the assignment was submitted

url.description: The URL of the submission (for 'online_url' submissions).

user_id.description: The id of the user who created the submission

workflow_state.description: The current state of the submission

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this submission without reference to the owning user. Only included if the caller has administrator access for the current account.

assignment_visible.description: Whether the assignment is visible to the user who submitted the assignment. Submissions where `assignment_visible` is false no longer count towards the student's grade and the assignment can no longer be accessed by the student. `assignment_visible` becomes false for submissions that do not have a grade and whose assignment is no longer assigned to the student's section.

body.description: The content of the submission, if it was submitted directly in a text field.

course.description: The submission's course (see the course API) (optional)

excused.description: Whether the assignment is excused.  Excused assignments have no impact on a user's grade.

extra_attempts.description: Extra submission attempts allowed fro the given user and assingment.

grade.description: The grade for the submission, translated into the assignment grading scheme (so a letter grade, for example).

grade_matches_current_submission.description: A boolean flag which is false if the student has re-submitted since the submission was last graded.

grader_id.description: The id of the user who graded the submission. This will be null for submissions that haven't been graded yet. It will be a positive number if a real user has graded the submission and a negative number if the submission was graded by a process (e.g. Quiz autograder and autograding LTI tools).  Specifically autograded quizzes set grader_id to the negative of the quiz id.  Submissions autograded by LTI tools set grader_id to the negative of the tool id.

html_url.description: URL to the submission. This will require the user to log in.

late.description: Whether the submission was made after the applicable due date

late_policy_status.description: The status of the submission in relation to the late policy. Can be late, missing, none, or null.

points_deducted.description: The amount of points automatically deducted from the score by the missing/late policy for a late or missing assignment.

posted_at.description: The date this submission was posted to the student, or nil if it has not been posted

preview_url.description: URL to the submission preview. This will require the user to log in.

read_status.description: The read status of this submission for the given user (optional). Including read_status will mark submission(s) as read.

redo_request.description: This indicates whether the submission has been reassigned by the instructor.

seconds_late.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that an submission is late by.

submitted_at.description: The timestamp when the assignment was submitted

url.description: The URL of the submission (for 'online_url' submissions).

user_id.description: The id of the user who created the submission

workflow_state.description: The current state of the submission

versions.description: an array of all the versions of this submission

SubmissionVersion.description: A SubmissionVersion object contains all the fields that a Submission object does, plus additional fields prefixed with current_* new_* and previous_* described below.

assignment_id.description: the id of the assignment this submissions is for

assignment_name.description: the name of the assignment this submission is for

body.description: the body text of the submission

current_grade.description: the most up to date grade for the current version of this submission

current_graded_at.description: the latest time stamp for the grading of this submission

current_grader.description: the name of the most recent grader for this submission

grade_matches_current_submission.description: boolean indicating whether the grade is equal to the current submission grade

graded_at.description: time stamp for the grading of this version of the submission

grader.description: the name of the user who graded this version of the submission

grader_id.description: the user id of the user who graded this version of the submission

id.description: the id of the submission of which this is a version

new_grade.description: the updated grade provided in this version of the submission

new_graded_at.description: the timestamp for the grading of this version of the submission (alias for graded_at)

previous_grade.description: the grade for the submission version immediately preceding this one

previous_graded_at.description: the timestamp for the grading of the submission version immediately preceding this one

previous_grader.description: the name of the grader who graded the version of this submission immediately preceding this one

score.description: the score for this version of the submission

url.description: the url of the submission, if there is one

user_id.description: the user ID of the student who created this submission

user_name.description: the name of the student who created this submission

workflow_state.description: the state of the submission at this version

position.description: 1 based

visibility.description: possible values are: public, members, admins, and none

account_id.description: The id of the root account that owns the Terms of Service

content.description: Content of the Terms of Service
content.example: To be or not to be that is the question

id.description: Terms Of Service id

passive.description: Boolean dictating if the user must accept Terms of Service

terms_type.description: The given type for the Terms of Service

resource_type_code.description: the resource type code of the resource handler to use to display originality reports

resource_url.description: a URL that may be used to override the launch URL inferred by the specified resource_type_code. If used a 'resource_type_code' must also be specified.

UsageRights.description: Describes the copyright and license information for a File

file_ids.description: List of ids of files that were updated

use_justification.description: Justification for using the file in a Canvas course. Valid values are 'own_copyright', 'public_domain', 'used_by_permission', 'fair_use', 'creative_commons'

User.description: A Canvas user, e.g. a student, teacher, administrator, observer, etc.

avatar_state.description: Optional If avatars are enabled and caller is admin, this field can be requested and will contain the current state of the user's avatar.

avatar_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

email.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users primary email address.

enrollments.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return a list of the users active enrollments. See the List enrollments API for more details about the format of these records.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

id.description: The ID of the user.

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

last_login.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return a timestamp representing the last time the user logged in to canvas.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

locale.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users locale in RFC 5646 format.

login_id.description: The unique login id for the user.  This is what the user uses to log in to Canvas.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

sections.description: A list of the sections this user is part of in the courses they are part of.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to manage SIS information.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

sortable_name.description: The name of the user that is should be used for sorting groups of users, such as in the gradebook.

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

avatar_state.description: Optional If avatars are enabled and caller is admin, this field can be requested and will contain the current state of the user's avatar.

UserDisplay.description: Abbreviated user object UserDisplay (see users API).

pronouns.description: The pronouns set on the profile (as of 12/02/2023 this is not in the API specification, but is returned with a profile call)

UserSectionInclude.description: Canvas user data provided in a section via include=['students']

created_at.description: The time at which this user was originally created

id.description: The ID of the user.

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.
